Row.Text: A Great Writer may only be selected if you have started the Aesthetics policy tree.
A Great Artist may only be selected if you have started the Aesthetics policy tree.
A Great Musician may only be selected if you have started the Aesthetics policy tree.
A Great General may only be selected if you have started the Honor policy tree.
A Great Admiral may only be selected if you have started the Exploration policy tree.
A Great Engineer may only be selected if you have started the Tradition policy tree.

[NEWLINE]Constructing nuclear weapons is forbidden by the Nuclear Non-Proliferation resolution of the World Congress.
[NEWLINE]City at maximum capacity for air units.
You have pillaged {1_Num} [ICON_GOLD], {2_Num} [ICON_CULTURE], and {3_Num} [ICON_GREAT_WORK] from the capture of {@4_CityName}!!!
Disable World Congress
Disables the World Congress system. No proposals or sessions will happen, and Diplomatic Victory will not be possible.
Disable Culture Overview UI
Disables the Culture Overview Screen. This affects only the UI and does not alter any of the core game mechanics.

Choose a city to move {1_SpyRank} {2_SpyName} into to begin operations.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE]When you move a spy into an opponent's [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital, you will be able to designate them as a diplomat.

Do you want this spy to be a diplomat? A spy can be a diplomat if they are placed in the capital of another civilization you are not at war with. (If war is declared, your spy will escape the city.) A diplomat will not attempt to steal technology from the other player but will still provide intrigue. Once the World Congress convenes, you will be able to determine their opinion on proposals and trade for their support if needed. If you have differing Ideologies, Diplomats will automatically conduct propaganda that provides a boost to [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism output to the target civilization.
Making Introductions

{1_RankName} {2_SpyName} is trying to make all the right connections in {3_CityName} as a diplomat. After they have made their introductions, he will be able to schmooze.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]A spy can be a diplomat if they are placed in the capital of another civilization. A diplomat will not attempt to steal technology from the other player but will still provide intrigue. Once the World Congress convenes and the diplomat has begun schmoozing, you will be able to determine their opinion on proposals and trade for their support if needed.
Schmoozing

{1_RankName} {2_SpyName} is schmoozing in {3_CityName} as a diplomat.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]A spy can be a diplomat if they are placed in the capital of another civilization you are not at war with. (If war is declared, your spy will escape the city.) A diplomat will not attempt to steal technology from the other player but will still provide intrigue. Once the World Congress convenes and the diplomat has begun schmoozing, you will be able to determine their opinion on proposals and trade for their support if needed. Diplomats also conduct propaganda that provides a boost to [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism output to the target civilization.
You may not see the city screen of {1_CityName}.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You have a diplomat in this city, but you must wait for it to finish making introductions before you can see the city screen.
Click to view the city screen of {1_CityName}.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]You may see the other player's city screen if your spy is a diplomat and is schmoozing around the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital.
Public Opinion
Because the empire has at least 10 [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness, an uprising has occurred in our territory!
A City Revolts!
Because the empire has at least 20 [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness and our public opinion is not Content, the city of {1_CityName} has revolted and joined {2_CivName}!
The {1_CivAdjective} city of {2_CityName} has revolted and joined {3_CivName}!
City Revolt Brewing

Because the empire has at least 20 [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] Unhappiness and our public opinion is not Content, a city will revolt in {1_Turns} turns. Based on current Unhappiness levels and pressure from nearby ideologies, the city most likely to revolt is {2_CityName} and it will join {3_CivName}. Try to get your empire's Happiness level out of this range as soon as possible!
